nl.tno.stormcv.util

Class StreamWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tno.stormcv.util.StreamWriter

  • public class StreamWriter
extends Object
    Utility class used to write frames to a video file and used by the StreamWriterOperation to store streams. By default the video is encoded as H264 at the original speed of the video (stream) being analyzed. This holds even if the framerate is very low (i.e. the spout only grabs a frame every second or so). It is possible to provide an additional speed factor (default = 1.0) to speed up or slow down the video being written. The owner of the StreamWriter must call close() to finish the file being written which performs the actual flush and close of the stream. If close is not called the file will most likely not be playable.
    Author:
    Corne Versloot

    • Constructor Detail

      • StreamWriter

        public StreamWriter(String location,
            FileConnector connector,
            com.xuggle.xuggler.ICodec.ID codec,
            float speed,
            long nrFramesVideo)
             throws IOException
        Creates a StreamWriter which will write provided frames to the location using the provided speed and codec
        Parameters:
        location - the location of the videofile to be written
        codec - the codec to use to encode the video
        speed - the speed to use (1 == normal speed, 2 == twice normal speed and 0.5 == half normal speed)
        nrFramesVideo - indicates how many frames must be written before a video is closed
        Throws:
        IOException

    • Method Detail

      • addFrames

        public void addFrames(List<Frame> frames)
               throws IOException
        Adds the set of frames to the file created by this StreamWriter. The characteristics of the stream (WxH and frame rate) are inferred automatically from the first set of frames provided which must be at least two subsequent frames.
        Parameters:
        frames - the set of frames to be added to the file
        Throws:
        IOException

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the video file and makes it playable. This method must be called by the owner or the file will never be closed and probably not playable
